coredata.dc:title: Synchrotron radiations studies of x-ray absorption spectra of ions in aqueous solutions
coredata.dc:creator: Eisenberger, P.
Kincaid, B.M.
coredata.dc:description:
Abstract
The K-edge photoabsorption spectra of Cu2+ and Br− ions in aqueous solutions were measured by using synchrotron radiation. From the spectra it was determined that the nearest neighbor distances Cu-O and Br-O were 1.97 ± 0.08 Å and 3.14 ± 0.1 Å respectively.

Struc- tunal studies in dilute solutions by normal X-ray elastic scattering techniques cannot be very success- fully performed because of the weak signal and large background scattering from the solvent [1,2] .
